title: Late Angels Pitcher Received Drugs From Team Employee
text:
Los Angeles Angels pitcher Tyler Skaggs’s July death—with oxycodone, fentanyl and alcohol in his system—has opened a new and explosive drug problem for Major League Baseball, as an Angels’ public-relations executive has spoken to federal investigators about his own drug use with Skaggs and the team’s knowledge of the situation.

Eric Kay, the Angels’ director of communications, told federal investigators that he provided oxycodone to Skaggs and abused it with him over an extended period of time, Kay’s attorney, Michael Molfetta,...
description: Angles pitcher Tyler Skaggs died in July with oxycodone, fentanyl and alcohol in his system. An Angels employee said he provided oxycodone to Skaggs and abused it with him.
